item.description:
May 20:Living Your Passion

 

To paraphrase Virginia Woolf, in order to express her creativity a woman needs to be financially independent and she needs a room of her own.

 

Using examples from her own life, as therapist, writer, teacher, workshop leader, mother and grandmother; ZsuZsa will share how you can use your passions to create a "room of your own." 

 

Some of the rewards are: 

  • staying focused on what is important to you
  • maintaining balance between your own needs and the needs of others
  • centering, which is a natural healing tool
  • joyful enthusiasm, a powerful motivational force
    creating a positive energy ripple effect
    manifesting results that empower and enhance your spirit 

Often, pursuing your passion also leads to financial independence!     

Certainly this is a topic that we all can relate to!!

 

ZsuZsa Simandy, LMSW, has been a holistic psychotherapist in private practice for over thirty years. She creates workshops, facilitates support groups, and teaches adult education courses, such as Finding Your Life Purpose and Live Your Passion, Follow Your Bliss. In 2002 and 2004 ZsuZsa co-created an all-day event, WOMEN'S PASSION IN ACTION at the Water's Edge Resort and Spa in Westbrook.For two years she wrote a column called THE LITTLE THINGS for Shore Publishing Newspapers. In 2007 ZsuZsa published a memoir,

GATHERING ROSES, THORNS AND ALL, Reflections on a Charmed Life.

She recently completed a romance novel and is working on two others--living her passions.
item.how_to_find_us: On the south side of Route 1--Boston Post RD--east of Big Y and Walmart. Comfort Keepers is upstairs
item.why: This is a busy time of year. Mark you calendar now!!
item.name: May AWBL--Living Your Passion
